snippet: Investigators reported that the pilot was expecting fewer passengers.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board determines that Paul Dudley, pilot of a helicopter that crashed into the East River in October 2011, failed to properly account for the weight of his passengers, three of whom died after being trapped underwater; Dudley strenuously disputes findings.
lead_paragraph: Investigators reported that the pilot was expecting fewer passengers.

headline.seo: Safety Board Says Helicopter in East River Crash Was Overloaded
headline.main: Safety Board Calls Copter in East River Crash Overloaded
headline.print_headline: Safety Board Says Copter In Crash Was Overloaded
